title: Senior Android Developer Consultant
description:
**About Us:**  

Dizayee Solutions AB is a growing IT consultancy company providing expert solutions to leading companies across Sweden and beyond. Our consultants work with cutting-edge technologies and diverse customers, primarily in the automotive industry, but we are not limited to this domain. Our team is built on professionalism, dedication, and technical excellence.
  
  

**Role Overview:**  

We are currently seeking a Senior Android Developer Consultant to join our team. In this role, you will work on exciting assignments with our customers, mainly within the automotive sector. As a consultant, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining high-quality Android applications tailored to our customers' specific needs.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Develop, maintain, and optimize Android applications with a strong focus on performance and usability.
  
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including UX/UI designers, backend developers, and product owners.
  
Participate in requirement analysis, architecture discussions, and code reviews.
  
Ensure code quality and best practices in development, testing, and documentation.
  
Follow customer-specific development processes, rules, and guidelines.
  
Deliver tasks and assignments as per customer specifications and timelines.
  
Adapt to different work environments and contribute positively to customer teams.
  
**Skills needed:** Android Studio, JetPack components, MVVM, MVI, Clean Architecture, Firebase Integrations, Dependency injections, RoomDb, SqlDelight, Sqlite, Rest api integrations, Version control systems (GitHub, Git, Bibucket), Segment, Mixpanel, OneSignal, Project Management Tools (Azure, Jira, Trello, Asana).
  
  

**Requirements:**  

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
  
5+ years of professional experience in Android application development.
  
Strong proficiency in Kotlin and Java.
  
Deep understanding of Android SDK, Android Studio, and modern development frameworks (Jetpack Compose, MVVM, etc.).
  
Experience working with RESTful APIs, third-party libraries, and cloud services.
  
Knowledge of unit testing and automation tools.
  
Familiarity with agile development methodologies.
  
Previous experience working in the automotive or embedded domain is a plus.
  
Excellent communication skills in English (Swedish is a plus).
  
Ability to work independently and manage customer expectations professionally.
  
  

**What We Offer:**  

Opportunities to work with leading clients and innovative projects.
  
A supportive and flexible work culture.
  
Competitive compensation and benefits.
  
Continuous learning and professional development.
  
  

**Additional Information:**  

As a consultant at Dizayee Solutions AB, you will follow all rules, regulations, and working standards set by our customers, and perform tasks as assigned under their project and team structures.
  
For further questions please feel free to contact mushir@dsab.eu or jibranbaladi@dsab.eu

title: Sr Java Backend Software Engineer
description:
**This is Worldline** 




 Worldline helps businesses of all shapes and sizes to accelerate their growth journey - quickly, simply, and securely. We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. Our technology powers the growth of millions of businesses across 5 continents. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.
 



  





**The Opportunity** 




 We are looking for an upbeat
 **Sr Java Backend Software Engineer** 
 to join our team. During your journey, you will become familiar with all different essential topics related to merchant facing digital services and you will increase your knowledge to step up further and challenge yourself.
 



  





 Being part of a product team, you will transfer the product vision into design, development, and delivery, to own the backlog toward building the right product. As it is a fairly new product\service, there is room for your own interpretation and freedom to steer the content of this role, based on your experience and character.
 



  





 In this role as experienced Engineer, you are expected to be able to grasp the business problem at hand and self-organize to deliver the solution. In this team we don’t delegate features to build but rather problems to solve for our engineers.
 



  





**The team** 




 You will be working in a team that today is working in an empowered way of working where we focus on Individual Contributors and involve engineers in the design process to have very good understanding of the What and Why before moving onto to How. Software engineers take on responsibility to design it, build it and ship it! Everyone in the team is value oriented and customer centric to solve real world merchant problems.
 



  





**Day-to-Day Responsibilities​** 



* You develop solutions for our customers based on current Java technologies (including JavaScript).
* Examine existing code, identify flaws and build solutions to improve it.
* Cooperate optimally with your team on the active sprint to craft new software solutions.
* Support the creation of technical concepts.
* Participate with recommendations regarding knowledge, priorities, and estimates.
* Help complete full software development processes for each assigned project, adhering to company standards and expectations.



  





**Who Are We Looking For** 




 People who can drive positive change, step up and show what’s next – people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. You have a professional approach, being constructive and finding solutions in the best interest of the business. You also:
 


* Have a Bachelor’s degree in computer science, software engineering, or another related field.
* Proven experience in Java and JavaScript.
* Previous experience working with AWS.
* Knowledge of database technologies especially SQL.
* Practical experience with version control systems like Git.
* Strong communication skills, with the ability to connect with both technical and non-technical colleagues.
* Strong analytical skills to effectively process and structure large amounts of information.
* Are a quick learner and self-starting, showing drive and initiatives supporting business goals.
* Are a great teammate who supports his team and puts the business objectives first.



  





**Perks & Benefits** 




 At Worldline, you’ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:
 


* Health contribution
* Health check – Every 2:nd year
* Private Health Care Insurance (EuroAccident)
* Parental pay and 12 months pension during parental leave
* Opportunity to hybrid working according to company standard
* Benefit portal with many great offers, plus more.



  





**Shape the evolution** 




 We are pushing towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers to join our journey. People with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. And with our empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career. Wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of over 18,000 innovators across 40+ countries, and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.
 



  





**Learn more about life at Worldline at jobs.worldline.com** 




  





**We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.**

title: Backend Developer
description:
Valtech is looking for a Backend Developer based in Stockholm. Are you passionate about building innovative, scalable solutions
 *,* 
 do you have an eye for detail, and do you thrive in collaborative working environment? Are you based in Stockholm and able to work on-site with our clients in the area on a regular basis? Then you might be the person we’re looking for! Keep reading to find out.
 



 We are looking for multiple profiles, both fluent in Swedish, and non-Swedish speaking.
 



  





**A day in the life of a Backend Developer** 




 Your role as a Backend Developer and a consultant at Valtech will not only entail providing technical expertise but also understanding the business needs of our clients and effectively communicating how our solutions can address their challenges and contribute to their success.
 



 Your responsibilities will encompass every stage of client engagements, from initial discovery to final delivery. This will involve close collaboration with local and regional project teams, both internally at Valtech and alongside our valued clients.
 



  





**In Addition, You Will** 



* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and mantain innovative solutions that meet client requirements
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of our development processes and methodologies
* Work with modern development practices, including CI/CD, containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), and automated testing
* Help maintain system documentation and participate in project reviews
* Actively participate in client meetings, workshops, and presentations to ensure alignment and transparency throughout the project lifecycle



  





**You and the role** 




 You are a developer at mid-to-senior level with at least 5 years of experience in the field of backend-end development. As a person, you are flexible and adaptable to changes, and can see yourself thriving in working in a highly innovative fast-paced start-up like environment.
 



  





**We would love if you have** 



* A relevant technical education or equivalent level of experience within the following areas or similar: computer science, software engineering, application development, backend engineering
* At least 5 years of professional experience in backend development, ideally in an agile project environment
* Preferable professional working experience from IT consultancy, digital agency, start-up or similar fast-paced working environment
* Proven track record of effectively engaging with stakeholders and identifying opportunities to add value to their projects
* Flexibility to work on-site in and around Stockholm multiple times a week



  





**Your Technical Skills Should Include** 



* Solid knowledge of both Java and .NET
* Experience working with cloud solutions (Azure, AWS, GCP)
* Ideally, you are comfortable working with containerized solutions (Kubernetes, Docker)
* Any experience or interest to work with Kotlin will be considered as a plus but is not required for this role
* Experience working in agile working environment with tools like Jira and Confluence



  





**What you can expect from us** 




 Valtech will always be recognized not just for the quality of the work we deliver, but for all the amazing people that make it happen. We don’t just talk about how to get things done; we really do transform by doing. We have an inclusive culture where we share our thoughts and our knowledge, we have fun together, and we care about each other. Our core values, Share, Care, Dare defines our culture and makes Valtech a workplace where you thrive and develop.
 



 Read more about life at Valtech here.
 



 You can read more about our benefits and what we offer here.
 



  





**Join Valtech** 




 Not only can you help us lead the experience revolution, but you can lead the change. The journey Valtech is on is ambitious and therefore opens doors. The more we grow – the more opportunities there are to take responsibility, implement your creative ideas, and be the innovator and driver to help move us, and our clients, forward.
 



**Does it excite you to join Valtech on this journey? And would you like to become our next Backend Developer?** 




**Then apply today** 
 . We cannot wait to hear from you!

title: Fullstack utvecklare med erfarenhet av Angular till kund inom elhandel - Castra
description:
*Vi utmanar de traditionella konsultbolagen och vi kan med stolthet säga att Castra är konsultbranschens mest utvecklande arbetsplats där allt är möjligt. Känns det här som företaget för dig så läs gärna vidare.*
 Om rollen
   

  

 Vi letar efter dig som brinner för att skapa snygga, smarta och användarvänliga lösningar till ett uppdrag hos kund som jobbar med elhandel och balanshantering. Du kommer att arbeta nära produktteamet med att utveckla gränssnitt och funktioner som gör verklig skillnad för våra användare. Rollen passar dig som både gillar att skriva snygg kod och har ett öga för UX och design.
   

  

 Din bakgrund
   

  

 Vi tror att du har:
   

  

* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av webbutveckling
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av Angular
* Goda kunskaper i TypeScript, Angular och REST API:er
* Erfarenhet av databaser, t.ex. MySQL
* Mycket god förståelse för JavaScript/TypeScript samt god koll på semantisk HTML och CSS
* Erfarenhet av .Net / C#


 Dina egenskaper
   

  

 För att trivas och lyckas i rollen tror vi att du:
   

  

* Har ett stort intresse för användarupplevelse och en känsla för design och detaljer
* Värdesätter hög kodkvalitet och skriver ren, underhållbar och välstrukturerad kod
* Har god förståelse för webben som plattform — hur webbläsare fungerar och bästa praxis kring säkerhet och prestanda
* Är van att arbeta med prestandafrågor och vet hur man både hittar och förebygger problem
* Gillar att vara med och diskutera tekniska lösningar och bidra i beslut kring arkitektur
* Är en lagspelare med positiv energi och prestigelös inställning


**Varför ska du välja oss?**
 Här tror vi på frihet, möjligheter och medbestämmande. Att du som medarbetare ska ha möjlighet att utvecklas och forma ditt arbete utefter dina intressen och prioriteringar i livet. Att alla får vara med och forma och påverka bolaget genom delägarskap, advisory board och projektgrupper. Att det är viktigt att ha ett sammanhang, känna tillhörighet och att man har kollegor som stöttar, utvecklar och tror på en.
   

  

**Om Castra**
 Castra är en entreprenörsdriven konsultgrupp inom IT, management och systemutveckling. Bolaget ägs gemensamt av medarbetarna och tillsammans bygger vi det företag vi själva vill jobba på.
   

  

 Vår vision är att vi ska vara Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare för konsulter. Att vi blivit certifierade av Great Place to Work® fem år i rad är ett bevis på våra höga mål kring företagskultur. Våra tankar om delaktighet, påverkansmöjligheter och respekt för individens egna val och möjligheter fungerar.
   

  

 Företaget har kontor i Göteborg, Stockholm, Helsingborg, Malmö, Linköping, Norrköping, Örebro och Jönköping. Mer information om Castra-koncernen hittar du på vår hemsida www.castra.se.
   

  

**Har vi lyckats väcka din nyfikenhet?** 
 Sök direkt via länken eller kontakta Charlotta.Ljung@castra.se eller 0728716312

title: Azure Arkitekt
description:
Brinner du för att lösa problem och skapa smarta, hållbara molnlösningar? Vill du vara en del av ett gäng som värdesätter både innovation och arbetsglädje? Då kan vi vara din nästa arbetsplats!
   

  

**Om rollen:**
 Som
 **Azure Cloud Arkitekt** 
 hos oss får du en
 **nyckelroll** 
 i att hjälpa våra kunder ta nästa steg i sin molnresa. Tillsammans med våra konsulter och utvecklare bygger du
 **hållbara och skalbara molnlösningar** 
 – alltid med fokus på innovation, säkerhet och effektivitet.
   

  

 💬
 **Lyssna och förstå** 
 – Du jobbar nära kunderna för att förstå deras behov och översätta dem till smarta lösningar.
   

  

 🛠️
 **Skapa och implementera** 
 – Designa arkitekturer, bygga skalbara miljöer och optimera befintliga system.
   

  

 🔍
 **Analysera och förbättra** 
 – Se till att prestanda, säkerhet och kostnadseffektivitet alltid är på topp.
   

  

 🤝
 **Samarbeta och dela kunskap** 
 – Vi tror på att växa tillsammans! Du blir en del av ett team där vi inspirerar och stöttar varandra.
   

  

 🎯
 **Sätta strategier** 
 – Hjälpa kunder att förstå molnets möjligheter och bygga en långsiktig roadmap.
   

  

 Hos oss får du
 **kombinera teknisk expertis med kreativ problemlösning** 
 – och samtidigt ha riktigt kul på jobbet!
   

  

**Är det här du?** 
 🌱
   

  

 ✔️ Du har minst fyra års erfarenhet som konsult inom molnteknik.
   

  

 ✔️ Du har jobbat med infrastruktur, inom Azure.
   

  

 ✔️ Du gillar att hitta smarta IT-lösningar och har ett öga för helheten.
   

  

 ✔️ Du pratar och skriver flytande svenska, då det krävs i det dagliga arbetet.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder** 
 🎁
   

  

**Flexibilitet** 
 – vi tror på balans mellan jobb och fritid.
 **Kompetensutveckling** 
 – utbildningar, certifieringar och en massa mer.
 **Härlig företagskultur** 
 – AW:s, konferensresor och roliga aktiviteter.
   

  

**Inkluderande arbetsmiljö** 
 – hos oss är alla välkomna och vi lyfter varandra!
   

  

**Vem är vi?** 
 🤗
   

  

 Vi är
 **B3 Cloud** 
 , ett härligt gäng på cirka 40 molnexperter i Stockholm och Göteborg. Vi är stolta över att vara en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser och vi brinner för att skapa innovativa lösningar tillsammans! 💡
   

  

**Om B3 Consulting Group**
*B3 Consulting Group är ett expansivt konsultbolag med cirka 1000 medarbetare. Vi brinner för innovation och hjälper Sveriges ledande företag och organisationer att skapa framtidens möjligheter genom digital transformation. B3 finns på* 
 tolv orter i Sverige samt i Polen, med huvudkontor i Stockholm. Bolaget grundades 2003, är noterat på Nasdaq Stockholm Small Cap och omsatte 1 141 MSEK 2023.
   

  

*Vi är stolta över vår prisbelönta företagskultur, där olikheter, erfarenheter och gemensam energi värdesätts. Som ett etiskt och transparent bolag strävar vi efter att ha en positiv påverkan på samhället, människor och miljön. Vi är även engagerade i Women in Tech och initiativ för att stärka AI-utbildning för kvinnor. 2024 utsågs vi till Årets Employer Branding-företag, och vår HR-chef vann titeln Årets HR-chef.*
 💌
 **Låter det spännande?** 
 Hör av dig! Vi ser fram emot att lära känna dig!

title: UX/UI Designer Intern
company_industry: Software Development, Manufacturing, and IT System Training and Support
description:
**XR Solutions** 
 is a technology based company that utilizes machine learning and powerful research-based optimizations to provide practical, reliable and optimizing augmented reality solutions to industrial companies.
 



 We believe that our AR technology can change working methods, the way of thinking and enable new innovative solutions that previously was not achievable in industry and machine operation.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 We are seeking a passionate and dedicated
 **UX/UI Designer** 
 to join our team for an Internship. This is an exciting opportunity for someone looking to gain hands-on experience in Design, Marketing and XR within a fast-paced and supportive environment.
 



  





**You will among other things be work with:** 




  




* Be involved in all stages of the design process within projects; from research, workshops, idea generation, concepts to prototypes and delivery of design.
* Create marketing content and be a part of taking our product to market.
* Create interaction design through customer journeys, sketches, wireframes and prototypes based on insights.
* Use creative tools like Figma and other suitable design software in the XR space.
* Conducting deep interviews and workshops for user research and product testing.
* Monitor and design the interface for head-mounted XR glasses and how the user should integrate with the software (e.g. Hand movements, eye tracking, etc.)



  





**To succeed in this role, you should have** 




  




* Previous of relevant work experience in UX/UI and
 **XR Design** 
 (
 **Meritorious)**
* An ability to easily communicate and work with others in teams, both with colleagues and customers.
* A self-propelled working method
* An ability to choose the tools and methods that best suit each specific situation.
* A user-focused mindset – a passionate drive for understanding and meeting user needs.
* Experience with Figma
* Open mindset to try new working methods and software tools that just launched on the market.



  





**What we offer** 



* Practical experience of e.g. product development in the AR-Space
* Opportunity to contribute directly to the growth of an exciting Startup
* Remote work and flex Office spaces
* Strategic work and planning
* Be part of a product launch



  





 If you’re excited about this opportunity and eager to learn, please send your resume outlining your interest in the position. We look forward to helping you grow your skills and advance your career in Design and marketing.
 



  





 This is a unpaid internship initially

title: Product Designer – Enterprise Products (Bangkok Based)
description:
****About Agoda****
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more . Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose –** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

****About Agoda****
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**The Domain of Enterprise Products**
 Behind the scenes of crafting compelling experiences for our millions of customers, we are diligently designing and optimizing hotel partner management products to cater to complex business scenarios on the B2B front. The enterprise products we develop at Agoda empower internal business users to control and update property information. Simultaneously, we enable over 600,000 properties worldwide to manage their content, pricing, allotments, customer segments, promotions, and market exposure effectively.
   

  

**Get to Know Our Team:**
 The Design team is a diverse group of product designers and researchers that help to build Agoda’s products from our home office in Bangkok. Being a product-driven company, we constantly partner with product managers and engineers to understand user problems and design workflows, interactions, and visual interfaces. There is always an opportunity for growth here. Focus on your craft to improve or expand your skill set, or step into a managerial role and flex your talents as a designer and driver of team projects. The opportunity and timing are now if you wish to come into a team that’s small enough to be scrappy and hands on, yet big enough to influence change and product strategy. Be a part of Agoda’s Design team and unlock the world for our global community of hotels and travelers.
   

  

**Experience Requirements & Role Expectations:**
* 5+ years of full-time experience as a UX/Interaction designer for digital or web-based products; in-house designer experience highly preferred
* Has experience of managing multiple stakeholders with agile development process
* Proficient in creating wireframes, UX design tools and prototyping
* A strong portfolio of work that demonstrates your design thinking, process, and solutions as it relates to web-based products or mobile applications that with complexities
* Good communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills in English
* Worked with enterprise products or B2B domain as a big plus


 The Enterprise Product Designer is an experienced problem solver for the areas with high complexity. He/she will work closely with Product stakeholders to collaborate and execute on the product team’s roadmap and milestones.
   

  

 The Enterprise Product Designer also possesses domain knowledge and expertise of the enterprise products or initiatives, to co-create future partner-centric product strategy or roadmap with your stakeholders. He/she will lead by creating alignment, telling compelling and persuasive stories to illustrate hotel partners’ problems connected with enterprise business journey, clearly articulate design decisions, driving and pushing for optimal UX solutions to stakeholders and influence the enterprise businessfor the longer term visions.
   

  

**Role Responsibility:**
* You will deliver hands-on design solutions for moderately complex enterprise business scenarios and well-defined business problems, aligning with property partners’ vision and our business goals
* You will actively engage in research and collaborate with our researcher to evaluate the impact of proposed solutions, driving improvements and refinements towards achieving desired outcomes in property partner-facing products
* You will acquire deep domain knowledge in both B2B and B2C aspects of the OTA (Online Travel Agency) business through daily collaboration with product leaders, analyzing research insights, and working closely with product stakeholders
* You will represent ‘Agoda Design’ by advocating user-centric design principles and engaging with external property partner touchpoints
* You will collaborate with product stakeholders to drive continuous discovery processes, validating and shaping ideas to experiment with and build upon, thereby influencing enterprise product strategy and roadmap


 #seattle #sanfrancisco #beijing #newyork #london #bangkok #singapore #chicago #hongkong #singapore #berlin #shanghai #losangeles #boston #austin #toronto #luxembourg #munich #oslo #copenhagen #stockholm #helsinki #brussels #hamburg #stuttgart #taipei #hamburg #stuttgart #dublin #telaviv #sydney #melbourne #perth #vancouver #montreal #prague #paris #dublin #telaviv #milan #rome #tokyo #osaka #amsterdam #moscow #saintpetersburg #frankfurt #shenzhen #istanbul #dubai #kiev #seoul
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .
   

  

**Disclaimer**
 We do not accept any terms or conditions, nor do we recognize any agency’s representation of a candidate, from unsolicited third-party or agency submissions. If we receive unsolicited or speculative CVs, we reserve the right to contact and hire the candidate directly without any obligation to pay a recruitment fee.

title: Azurearkitekt
description:
*Redpill Linpro är ledande specialister inom open source och brinner för öppna lösningar, öppna affärsmodeller och ett öppet samhälle. Tillsammans samverkar vi för att uppnå maximal nytta för alla. Hos oss finns några av marknadens främsta experter inom sina specialområden. Vi är omkring 300 anställda och du finner oss i tre länder på sex kontor: Stockholm, Göteborg, Karlstad, Linköping samt i Köpenhamn och Oslo.*
**Vi är öppna – är du?**
 Är du redo att vara en del av framtidens molnlösningar? Vår verksamhet inom Azure Services växer, och vi söker nu efter fler underbara kollegor som brinner för att utveckla, designa och implementera systemlösningar i Azure!
   

  

 Som Azurearkitekt hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta med både publika och privata molnlösningar där du kommer att ansvara för att utveckla lösningar på Azure-stacken. Arbetet kommer variera mellan olika plattformarna där integration kommer vara en återkommande del. På Redpill Linpro värdesätter vi samarbete och du kommer att arbeta nära andra kollegor för att göra en verklig skillnad för samhället, tillsammans med våra kunder.
   

  

 För att trivas i rollen känner du dig bekväm med att designa system som tar hänsyn till framtida förändringar. Du tänker proaktivt och har förståelse för att affärsprocesser ska tas hänsyn till innan du ger dig på tekniken. Vidare förstår du skillnaden mellan att jobba ”agilt” och att designa ett "agilt" system. Du vill lära dig nya saker och är bekväm med att ifrågasätta dina egna lösningar. Du frågar inte efter en färdig kravspecifikation men är villig att ta fram denna tillsammans med kunden.
   

  

**Som Azurearkitekt hos oss kommer du att arbeta med:**
* Ta fram krav tillsammans med kunden
* Identifiera ”core use-cases” utifrån framtagna krav
* Ta fram arkitektur på en konceptuell nivå och föreslå dens möjliga realiseringar
* Ta fram kostnadskalkyler och motivera val av tekniker
* Serverless teknologier
* Container lösningar
* Meddelandebaserade kommunikationsteknologier (ServiceBus, EventHub, etc)
* Diverse storage lösningar (SQL, Cosmos, Blob etc.)
* API design och livscykel
* DevOps
* C#, .NET, Typescript, Javascript eller Java


**Vem är du?**
 För att trivas som konsult hos oss är det viktigt att du har ett stort teknikintresse och en vilja att utveckla dig inom nya områden och ny teknik. Du drivs av problemlösning och delar värderingen att samarbete är det som tar oss framåt.
   

  

**Utöver detta ser vi att du uppfyller följande:**
* Har några års erfarenhet av utveckling, arkitektur eller liknande arbete
* Har goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska
* Du har varit med/ansvarat för kommunikationen med affärssidan för att förstå vad det är för system man bygger och vem man bygger det för


**Meriter:**
* Du har gått kurser som ges av iDesign eller Barry O'Reilly på DF Kompetens.
* Du är certifierad arkitekt
* Du har tidigare suttit med konsultarbete eller tagit fram kravställning hos kunder


 Tveka inte att höra av dig om du vill arbeta med oss. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

 We are passionate about open solutions, open business models, and an open society where we work together for maximum benefit to everyone. We have got some really skilled co-workers here at Redpill Linpro, particularly within our main areas: API management, development, IT operations, data analytics, customer experience, cloud, DevOps, and automation.
   

  

**May the Source be with you!**

title: Cloud Architect
description:
Solteq is a Nordic provider of IT services and software solutions specializing in the digitalization of business and industry-specific software. The key sectors in which we have long term experience include retail, industry, energy and services.
   

  

 Our mission is to simplify the digital world to make a better tomorrow.
   

  

 We are an insightful and dedicated team of experts. We are passionate and humble listeners, driven by the desire for the best customer understanding. We make customer success stories with remarkable experiences and solutions that deliver lasting value.
   

  

 Our over 400 experts, who work in six countries, develop and implement solutions for clients mainly in the Nordic countries.
   

  

 We are constantly looking for new people to join our growing team. Take a look at our open positions and join us in developing remarkable experiences and solutions that deliver lasting value.
   

  

**Discover More About Who We Are!**
 Are you passionate about designing cutting-edge cloud solutions and ensuring seamless integration between systems? Do you thrive in an environment where you can take ownership of projects, make architectural decisions, and work with the latest cloud technologies?
   

  

 We invite you to join our
 **Cloud and Connectivity team** 
 , where you will collaborate with skilled professionals to create
 **highly available, secure, and scalable cloud architectures** 
 . Here, you’ll have the opportunity to shape the direction of integration projects and work in an environment that fosters continuous learning and career growth.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Design and implement secure, high-availability cloud architectures using Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud
* Define cloud environments with Infrastructure-as-Code tools such as Bicep, ARM, Terraform, or AWS CDK
* Work with container technologies and orchestration tools like Kubernetes (AKS, EKS)

**What We’re Looking For**
* Proven experience in cloud solution design and architecture.

* Hands-on experience with containerization and orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes).
* Deep understanding of DevOps models and CI/CD technologies.
* Strong leadership and communication skills to drive projects successfully.


**Why Join Us?**
* Competitive salary and benefits.
* Flexible working environment (remote/hybrid options).

**Want to be part of our team? Click Apply we'll be in contact!**
 By clicking apply you can choose to attach your LinkedIn profile or CV and application. The choice is yours! Whatever you choose to do please don't hesitate, we will start the recruitment process and interviews immediately.
   

  

 Questions? Please contact Markus Forss for more information by email markus.forss@solteq.com.

title: Technology/Climate technology Underwriter
description:
Chubb is a world leader in insurance. With operations in 54 countries and territories, Chubb provides commercial and personal property and casualty insurance, personal accident and supplemental health insurance, reinsurance and life insurance to a diverse group of clients. As an underwriting company, we assess, assume and manage risk with insight and discipline. We service and pay our claims fairly and promptly. The company is also defined by its extensive product and service offerings, broad distribution capabilities, exceptional financial strength and local operations globally. Parent company Chubb Limited is listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: CB) and is a component of the S&P 500 index. Chubb maintains executive offices in Zurich, New York, London, Paris and other locations, and employs approximately 40,000 people worldwide. Additional information can be found at: www.chubb.com .
 



  





 In the Nordics we are an organization of 140 employees.
 



  





**The role purpose** 




  





 Chubb is growing and we are looking for a passionate Technology/Climate technology Underwriter to join our Technology Practice team in the Nordics. In the role as Underwriter, you will focus specifically on Technology and Climate Technology.
 



  





 Are you ready for the next step in your career and would you prefer to take it in a fun and professional team at an international, renowned insurer? Then you are in the right place.
 



  





 This exciting role can suit an Underwriter who is hungry, motivated, inquisitive and in need of a new challenge. We will consider a similar minded hardworking person who feels ready to take the next step in the career.
 



  





 We require someone to develop and assist in underwriting Technology risks. Maintaining and building relationships with our Nordic brokers community with an ambition to write additional new business, which will be key to the success of this role, as well as growing the existing portfolio in line with our agreed growth targets, pricing and retention budget.
 



  





**You make an impact and strengthen our market position by:** 



* Building and maintaining good relationships with brokers.
* Promoting our capabilities and building of a profitable Technology/climate technology portfolio.
* Strong commercial drive, always looking for new opportunities and value service and quality.
* Ensuring quality control by means of including underwriting and peer reviews.
* Representing and promoting Chubb to brokers and clients.
* Delivering strong service to brokers and clients, responding to cross-sell and new business opportunities and monitoring retention.
* Meeting the portfolio product line objectives of the Northern Zone Technology practice team for each underwriting year.



  





**Profile requirements :** 



* Fundamental understanding of and experience from underwriting processes preferably within Technology and Climate Technology
* Degree in Engineering, Computer sciences or business administration or technical / business experience background with an interest for new technologies.
* A strong commercial drive and very customer-oriented approach.
* Experience from client servicing preferably from the insurance industry.
* Demonstrated skills in building and maintaining client relationships preferably from the insurance industry.
* Results driven, disciplined and ambitious with ability to work on own initiative.
* Good communicator and fluent in Swedish (or another Nordic language) and high level of English written as well as spoken.



  





**Why You Want To Work At Chubb** 



* We offer a high-performance work environment in which appreciation and inclusiveness are of paramount importance.
* As an underwriter at Chubb, no two days are the same. You interact with various stakeholders and actively pursue opportunities. Where you do that? From our office in Stockholm, on location during meetings with clients/brokers or from your home office.
* At Chubb, the customer experience is key. With us, insurance is not a static product, but is continuously adapted to the needs of the market.
* As a Chubb employee, you are part of the world's largest publicly traded property and casualty insurance company, providing solutions to businesses of all sizes.
* At Chubb, we operate on the basis of trust. You have a high degree of autonomy, flexibility and also access to a multitude of training and development opportunities.



  





 If you have any questions, please feel free to contact
 **Robin Roos** 
 , Technology Practice Leader for the Northern Zone via:
 ***Tel: + 31 61422 8765 / Robin.Roos@chubb.com.***




 We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Integration Consultant
description:
**Den viktiga digitaliseringen av vården fortsätter att utvecklas och i takt med det växer B3 HealthTech så att det knakar. Vi söker nu erfarna integrationskonsulter som vill bli en del av ett företag som bidrar till att tillgängliggöra och effektivisera det svenska hälso- och sjukvårdsystemet.**
 Vi söker dig som vill arbeta i ett företag med sympatiska värderingar, erfarna kollegor och ett härlig driv. Om du, liksom vi, värnar om en arbetsmiljö där ödmjukhet, prestigelös kunskapsdelning och energi frodas så är detta en unik chans för dig att vara med och bidra till vår starka kultur. Hos oss får du även möjlighet att växa i din yrkesroll och vara med och bidra till samhällsnyttig utveckling varje dag.
   

  

**Om rollen** 
**:**
 Som konsult hos oss får du chansen att arbeta med intressanta uppdrag hos våra kunder inom både den privata och den offentliga sektorn för att stödja dem i deras digitaliseringsresor. I rollen kan du komma att få arbeta med integration av verksamhetskritiska system inom hälso- och sjukvården, integration av nationella tjänster, utveckling och integration mellan privata vårdaktörer och nationella hälso- och sjukvården och mycket annat.
   

  

**Ett CV säger inte allt, men vi ser att:**
* Du har arbetat med systemintegrationer och API:er.
* Du har goda kunskaper inom Mulesoft, Apache Camel, intersystem eller liknande.
* Du har erfarenhet från att ha arbetat med integrationslösningar för större organisationer.
* Du har minst 4 års relevant erfarenhet.
* Du behärskar svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.


**Det är en bonus om:**
* Du tidigare har arbetat som konsult.
* Du har arbetat med Cosmic eller integrationer mot vårdinformationsstöd
* Arbetat med integrationslösningar mot större datalager.
* Du har erfarenhet från att ha arbetat med standarder för medicinsk informatik. Som exempelvis FHIR, HL7, OpenEHR eller liknande.


**Vi erbjuder**
* Attraktiv lönemodell.
* Friskvårdsbidrag och tjänstepension.
* Goda förutsättningar för flexibla arbetstider
* Möjligheter att gå relevanta utbildningar och ta attraktiva certifikat.
* En fantastisk wellness-satning.


 B3 HealthTech är en del av B3 Consulting Group, ett av Sveriges snabbast växande företag inom IT och management. Således kan vi erbjuda det bästa av två världar - styrkan hos ett stort börsnoterat bolag i kombination med den härliga samhörigheten som ett mindre bolag erbjuder. I och med att vi enbart är 35 medarbetare så hamnar dessutom fokus på dig och dina unika utvecklingsbehov.
   

  

 Vi är stolta över att vi vann priset som ”Årets Karriärföretag” 2022, vilket vi även är nominerade till i år, och kom på tredje plats som Sveriges bästa bolag enligt ”Great Place to Work 2021”. Vi tror att det beror på vår energi, vårt sätt att välkomna olikheter och våra erfarenheter som vi gärna delar med oss av. En central del av energiskapandet är vår unika wellness-satsning Team B3. Vad sägs om 250+ aktiviteter som sträcker sig från Crossfit, Vasa lopp och padelspel till bokklubbar, handarbetescafé och brädspelskvällar. Vi tror att medarbetare som mår bra, presterar bra och vill vara engagerade kollegor och goda medmänniskor.
   

  

 De som jobbar kvar hos oss efter många år pratar om friheten att påverka sina uppdrag, arbetstider och utveckling. De talar även om stoltheten över att vara en del av ett bolag som inte bara levererar förstklassigt resultat till sina kunder utan även tar ansvar för samhället i stort bl.a. genom att vara partner till fina initiativ som Women in Tech, Changers Hub, Pink Programming m.fl.
   

  

**Låter det som något för dig?**
 Vi vill fortsätta att växa, så ansök till oss idag och följ med på vår resa mot en mer effektiv hälso- och sjukvård. Vi kommer att intervjua kandidater löpande och ber dig därför att skicka in din ansökan redan idag.
   

  

 Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mail, men har du frågor som rör tjänsten så tveka inte att höra av dig till Christina Löfgren christina.lofgren@b3.se 079-3356532

title: Infrastructure Lead
description:
**Description**
*Position at LeoVegas Group*
**About The Role**
 Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) is a critical part of our platform strategy. As a leader of the SRE team, you will focus on guiding your team in providing technical expertise and support to our engineering teams to enable them to deliver high-quality software solutions efficiently.
   

  

 Your team will be responsible for providing continuous support to other departments, overcoming major technical hurdles, improving performance , implementing system monitoring and building highly available software.
   

  

 YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:
   

  

* Providing support and leadership for our SRE team to solve operational challenges.
* Managing the assignment of tasks for the team according to priorities and capacity.
* Having a positive attitude and the ability to understand the critical urgency of topics and strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Ensuring non-functional requirements for all applications and tools are met and clearly communicated.
* Providing counsel to our internal software engineering team and proactively suggesting improvements on how to operate our microservice-based solution.
* Provide informal feedback on an ongoing basis and formal feedback in the annual performance evaluation process to identify and develop talent.
* Coaching Payments Product team members in achieving goals and developing necessary skills.
* Organise team trainings and initiatives.
* Identify team goals and evaluate team progress.


 OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING:
   

  

**Essential Skills**
* Minimum 5 years of software engineering or devops experience.
* Minimum 2 years of experience as a team lead or manager.
* Practical experience in using common cloud APIs.
* Strong knowledge of Linux and shell scripting, as well as higher level protocols and patterns like HTTP/3, REST, JSON and gRPC.
* Expertise in systems integration and distributed large scale microservice deployments.
* Experience in operating and monitoring container workloads and similar technologies.
* Strong code reading and understanding skills with at least one high level programming language


 NICE TO HAVES
   

  

* Experience from the iGaming industry is meriting


**Who We Are**
 At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1800 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 16 offices worldwide.
   

  

**Benefits**
* Hybrid work policy.
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply).
* 30 annual vacation days.
* Occupational Pension.
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually.
* Parental Leave Top-Up.
* Possibility to enroll in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner.
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance.
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts.
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.


 JOIN US
   

  

 In our pride, we empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait for things to happen; we pounce and make it happen!
   

  

 Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!
   

  

* As our company working language is English, we’d like to see your CV in English, please\*\*

title: Head of Engineering
description:
**Why Join Us?**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
   

  

 We’re at an exciting stage in our journey, growing rapidly and expanding our Product & Development team in Stockholm to build a vibrant hub for innovation, product design, and technology. This is a unique opportunity to join a thriving organization where you can help shape the future of assistive communication, defining how we work and delivering impactful solutions for our users.
   

  

 We are building a culture of empowered, collaborative teams who are passionate about helping individuals with disabilities find their voice and connect with the world. Our teams thrive on trust, collaboration, and a positive environment where everyone lead and contributes. We deeply understand the people we serve, empathize with their challenges, and use our expertise to make a real difference.
   

  

 As our
 **Head of Engineering** 
 , you will play a vital role in leading and scaling our engineering organization across software, hardware, and cloud. You will partner closely with product and design leaders to deliver inclusive, high-impact solutions that change lives, and be a key force in shaping the future of our technology, teams, and culture.
   

  

**In this role, you will:**
* Lead, coach, and grow a team of senior engineering managers and a principal architect, fostering a high-performing, psychologically safe, and inclusive environment.
* Drive engineering excellence across architecture, scalability, DevOps, code quality, and reliability.
* Champion collaboration in the Tech/Product/Design (TPD) triad, ensuring strong cross-functional alignment and impact.
* Own and evolve the technical strategy and architectural roadmap to support long-term innovation and business success.
* Ensure high-quality, on-time delivery across all product lines
* Help shape and refine the engineering organization’s operating model, workflows, and metrics.
* Play an active role in talent strategy, hiring, and development to build a diverse, world-class engineering team.
* Contribute to the broader product and business strategy as a trusted advisor to the Chief Product & Development Officer (CPDO) and Product Development leadership.


**What We're Looking For:**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* A Master’s degree in Computer Science or a related field.
* Extensive experience in product development and engineering leadership.
* A strong track record of building and leading successful product engineering teams.
* Demonstrated success in hiring and nurturing top engineering talent.
* Deep knowledge of software development practices and product architecture.
* Experience aligning technical execution with product and business goals.
* Excellent communication, collaboration, and stakeholder management skills.
* Fluency in both English and Swedish.
* Experience leading organizational transformation is a plus.


**You’ll thrive in this role if you:**
* Are passionate about people, leadership, and purpose-driven product development.
* Are energized by building and scaling high-impact engineering teams.
* Have a deep curiosity about users and a desire to create accessible, empowering solutions.
* Bring a positive, solution-oriented mindset and a strong ability to prioritize and influence.
* Enjoy working in a fast-paced, collaborative environment where learning and growth are continuous.


**Our Values:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
   

  

**What We Offer:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
   

  

* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Storage & Backup Administrator
description:
Job Title:
 **Storage & Backup Administrator**
 Job Location:
 **Stockholm, Kista 16440/ Onsite**
 Job Type: O
 **pen for both, preferably permanent.**
**Key Responsibilities**
**Storage and Backup Administrator Job description**
**Storage Management**
* Design, implement, and maintain the organization s Storage Area Networks (SAN), Network-Attached Storage (NAS) systems.
* Monitor and manage storage performance, capacity, and utilization, ensuring efficient and optimal use of resources.
* Manage storage provisioning, including creating, allocating, and maintaining logical volumes, storage pools, and file systems.
* Perform storage performance tuning, capacity planning, and troubleshooting to ensure reliable and high-performing storage environments.
* Maintain and monitor data replication, mirroring, and cloning solutions for high availability and disaster recovery purposes.
* Manage storage integration with virtualization platforms (e.g., VMware, etc.) and on-premises environments


**Backup Management**
* Design, configure, and maintain backup infrastructure and solutions, ensuring all critical data is backed up in accordance with company policies and regulatory requirements.
* Develop and manage backup policies and schedules, ensuring timely and reliable backups of all key systems, databases, and files.
* Utilize backup technologies such as Veeam and EMC Networker
* Monitor backup jobs for failures, troubleshoot issues, and ensure successful data recovery when necessary.
* Regularly perform data recovery drills to validate the effectiveness of backup and disaster recovery solutions.


**Disaster Recovery & Data Protection**
* Develop and maintain comprehensive disaster recovery (DR) plans for storage and backup systems, ensuring minimal data loss and quick recovery in the event of an outage.
* Work closely with other teams to ensure that disaster recovery plans are regularly tested, validated, and updated based on changes to the environment.
* Implement and manage data retention and archiving policies in accordance with business and regulatory requirements.
* Ensure that all storage and backup systems comply with security protocols, including encryption, access controls, and auditing.


**Monitoring & Reporting**
* Monitor storage and backup systems for performance, capacity, and potential issues using management tools and dashboards.
* Generate regular reports on storage usage, backup success rates, data recovery readiness, and performance metrics.
* Proactively identify storage and backup issues and recommend improvements to increase system reliability and efficiency.


**Collaboration & Support**
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including database administrators, application teams, and IT support, to ensure seamless integration of storage and backup systems with other enterprise infrastructure.
* Provide tier 2/3 support for storage and backup-related incidents, working quickly to resolve issues and restore services.
* Document storage and backup configurations, processes, and troubleshooting procedures for reference and audits.


**Qualifications**
 Required Skills:
   

  

* Experience in designing, implementing, and managing enterprise storage systems, including SAN, NAS and cloud storage solutions.
* Strong understanding of backup technologies e.g., EMC Networker, Veeam, Quantum Tape Library and disaster recovery methodologies.
* Hands-on experience with storage platforms from vendors such as Dell EMC Unity, Dell EMC Data Domain, NetApp, HPE Primera, 3PAR, Oracle ZFS and IBM.
* Proficiency in managing storage in virtualized environments (e.g., VMware vSphere, Aria, VMware Cloud Directory
* Knowledge of data replication, mirroring, and snapshot technologies for business continuity.
* Familiarity with RAID levels, block storage, object storage, and file system concepts.
* Strong troubleshooting skills for both storage and backup systems.


**Preferred Skills**
* Knowledge of scripting for automation (PowerShell, Python, Bash).
* Storage-related certifications such as NetApp Certified Data Administrator (NCDA), Dell EMC Proven Professional.
* Familiarity with networking concepts and data center infrastructure.
* ITIL certification for understanding service management best practices.


**Education And Experience**
* Bachelor s degree in information technology, Computer Science, or a related field.
* 10+ years of experience managing enterprise storage and backup solutions.
* Certifications in storage management and backup technologies are a plus.


**Additional Competencies**
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills for working across teams and departments.
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects or tasks simultaneously.
* Attention to detail and a commitment to maintaining the integrity and security of critical data.


**Regards,**
 Rachana
   

  

 rachana@falconsmartit.com

title: Business Controller
description:
**Business Controller – Foxway Group** 




  





**Drive business performance in one of Europe’s most dynamic circular tech scale-ups.** 




  





*Foxway Group is a leading European provider of circular tech solutions, helping organizations improve their IT sustainability by increasing circularity across the value chain. Since partnering with Nordic Capital in 2023, Foxway is scaling fast – aiming to become a global leader in circular tech.* 




  





*We are now recruiting a commercially minded Business Controller to join the finance team within CWS – Circular Workspace, one of Foxway’s core business units. In this role, you’ll work closely with sales, operations, and leadership to drive insights, improve performance, and contribute to the strategic direction of the business. You report directly to the CFO of Foxway CWS.* 




  





**What you'll do** 



* Develop and improve sales KPIs – including pipeline, win rates, and deal sizes – and build forecasting models to support proactive decisions and identify growth opportunities.
* Collaborate with the sales team to optimize commercial terms, drive profitability in the DaaS offering, and implement a sharper KPI structure.
* Monitor and challenge operational performance – backlog, SLA, capacity – and drive short-term actions to unlock revenue.
* Turn data into narrative – help decision-makers understand the “why” behind the numbers through clear dashboards, storytelling, and strategic insights.
* Lead and facilitate cross-functional business reviews, aligning finance with operations and commercial stakeholders.
* Contribute to planning and forecasting processes and support the FP&A agenda across the group.



  





**Who you are** 



* You hold an MSc or BSc in Finance, Business, or a related field, and bring at least seven years of experience—starting in M&A or Transaction Services, followed by a few years in FP&A or business controlling.
* You are fluent in business intelligence – especially Power BI – and comfortable building tools, not just using them.
* You’re commercially driven and thrive in close collaboration with sales teams.
* You communicate clearly and persuasively – both in slides and in meetings.
* You're hands-on, curious, and like to turn complexity into clarity.



  





 We believe the ideal candidate is a curious, energetic problem-solver with a strong financial mindset, eager to make a difference and grow with the company. They will thrive in taking responsibility and working independently.

 – Create a clear territory plan and exceed revenue targets
   

  

 ✔
 **Leverage top-tier SaaS sales methodologies** 
 – Apply MEDDIC, Challenger, and value-based selling to drive deal success
   

  

 ✔
 **Collaborate with Pre-Sales** 
 – Work with technical experts to deliver the best possible solutions for customers
   

  

**What it´s like to sell Frends?** 
 You can read Frends Senior Account Executive thoughts from our blog.
   

  

 Why Join Frends Now?
   

  

* Be Part of a Strong, Scaling Team: Sweden is already established, and we are growing further
* Make an Impact: Affect Frends' growth in Sweden, shaping success in this strategic region
* Career Growth: Take on a critical role with continuous learning in a fast-growing company
* Nordic Leader, Global Challenger: Join one of the Nordics' top integration technology organizations with its own platform, Frends, a well-established product with strong demand
* Thriving Integration Field: Join a vital and growing field of integrations where your skills make a difference—integrations keep the world spinning
* Pre-Sales Support: Collaborate with presales and other experts to craft the best solutions for diverse use cases
* Work Flexibly: Enjoy modern, flexible working times and hybrid remote work
* Competitive Compensation: Earn a fixed salary with performance-based incentives


**Read from our fresh blog why talents choose Frends and why Frendszies stay with us.**
 What You Bring
   

  

 ✅
 **Strong B2B SaaS / Software solution sales expertise** 
 – with a 5+ year track record of success in Saas/PaaS new business acquisition, you know how to sell value, navigate complex sales cycles, and influence key
 **Enterprise IT decision-makers**
 ✅
 **Ability to navigate enterprise organizations,** 
 identifying key stakeholders and building a strong sales pipeline
   

  

 ✅
 **Ability to build pipeline & close deals** 
 – You take full ownership of your territory and prospecting strategy
   

  

 ✅
 **Knowledge & curiosity towards technical solutions** 
 – understanding of integration technology, familiarity with SaaS/PaaS solutions, ideally also iPaaS
   

  

 ✅
 **Fluent in high-impact SaaS sales methodologies** 
 – Familiarity with MEDDIC, SPIN, Challenger Sales, or similar
   

  

 ✅
 **Great** 
**communication & negotiation skills** 
 – You can confidently handle high-stakes sales conversations and adept at identifying and utilizing internal resources to support your sales cycle
   

  

**✅ Superb listening skills** 
 – You must understand and empathize with our customers/prospects' pain points with a solution and value-based mindset
   

  

**Location & Language:** 
**The role requires fluent/native Swedish and professional English** 
 (both verbally and in writing), as well as
 **living in Sweden with a work permit.** 
 We support hybrid work mode but also require visiting our Stockholm office in Katarinavägen on a weekly basis. Occasionally, traveling is needed to meet customers and teams and attend events.
   

  

 ⭐ Interested in joining us?  Apply now!
   

  

 If you want to impact and join our growth journey, please contact us and tell us more about yourself!
   

  

**Additional Information**
* The start is flexible according to your situation, and we offer a permanent, full-time position.
* The position will be filled as soon as the right person is found.
* You will be reporting to the Regional Director, Sweden.
* Our recruitment process includes around three discussions with a case presentation included. To ensure a smooth and informative process, you will meet at least our People Integrator, Regional Director, Sweden, and CRO. Reference checks are also included.
* Please note that we accept applications for this position only through our career website.

title: Senior Backend Engineer - Sports
description:
**Description**
*Position at LeoVegas Group*
**About The Role**
 We are looking for a Backend Engineer in our Sportsbook domain.
   

  

 In this role you will be an integral part of our team, contributing to the development and maintenance of our robust and scalable technology stack.
   

  

 Working with the latest technologies, you will help build and enhance our cloud-based platforms, ensuring they are distributed, scalable, and fault-tolerant to meet the specific demands in the betting market and our rapidly growing user base.
   

  

 This role offers an exciting opportunity for you who are passionate about technology, enjoy working in a fast-paced environment, and are committed to delivering exceptional results. If you are someone who thrives on challenges, values teamwork, and is eager to make a meaningful impact, we want to hear from you!
   

  

 YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:
   

  

* Developing, designing, and refactoring microservices.
* Conducting code reviews and providing mentorship to team members.
* Integrating new products and building internal services to support our ecosystem.
* Taking ownership of problem-solving, collaborating with other teams when necessary.


 OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE:
   

  

 ESSENTIAl SKILLS:
   

  

* You have experience with common Java frameworks such as Spring and JPA
* Experience with Kotlin
* Demonstrated ability to build services from scratch.
* You’re no stranger to working with relational databases such as MySQL
* You have experience in building scalable and fault-tolerant systems and are familiar with microservice architectures


 NICE TO HAVES:
   

  

* Familiarity with additional technologies such as Akka, Hazelcast, Elasticsearch, Kafka, RabbitMQ, Consul, Google Cloud Platform, and BigQuery.


 WHO ARE WE?
   

  

 At the core of LeoVegas Group, is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1400 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 11 offices world-wide.
   

  

**Benefits**
* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enroll in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.


 JOIN US!
   

  

 In our pride, we like to empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait around for things to happen, we pounce and make it happen!
   

  

 If you think you would be a good fit for the Leo pride - give us a roar!
   

  

 \*\*As our company working language is English we’d like to see your CV in English please\*\*

title: Senior Sales Manager- Nordics
Revenue Operations Manager
description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.
   

  

 We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you’ll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.
   

  

 We’re looking for a
 **Revenue Operations Manager** 
 to help us design, optimize, and scale how we track and drive revenue at Mentimeter. Sitting at the intersection of marketing, data, and operations, this role will own the development and implementation of revenue attribution models, build scalable customer journey tracking systems, and enable data-driven marketing strategies.
   

  

 You’ll apply a practical technical skillset to accelerate progress—configuring tools, connecting data sources, and leveraging automation or AI where it adds value. You’ll use data to uncover insights, identify bottlenecks, and support smarter decision-making across the funnel. You should understand how systems interact and can collaborate confidently with technical teams to make things happen. You’re a curious, structured thinker with a commercial mindset who can turn ambiguity into action.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Revenue Attribution & Measurement
* Build and continuously improve attribution models that track the full B2B customer journey across touchpoints.
* Ensure accuracy and completeness in tracking marketing influence on pipeline and revenue.
* Journey Design & Optimization
* Collaborate with marketing and sales teams to map end-to-end customer journeys and implement tracking logic aligned with business objectives.
* Use data insights to refine campaigns, channels, and handoff points.
* Systems & Tools Management
* Oversee integration and performance of tools such as Salesforce, Braze, 6sense, and Looker.
* Identify system gaps or data issues that impact attribution accuracy or marketing insight.
* Lead platform optimization and workflow automation efforts to reduce manual work.
* Data Collaboration & Insights
* Partner with Revenue Analytics and Data teams to ensure clean, consistent data across platforms.
* Develop dashboards and reporting structures to surface actionable performance insights for marketing and sales.
* Cross-functional Project Leadership
* Scope technical requirements and coordinate implementation of attribution-related projects.
* Established as a revenue craft expert to stakeholders across marketing, sales, and data functions. Advocate for systems thinking and measurable outcomes in campaign planning and GTM execution.
* Evaluation & Innovation
* Evaluate emerging tools and technologies that improve how we attribute revenue and understand buyer behavior.
* Recommend solutions that enhance visibility and decision-making across the funnel.


**What Success Looks Like**
 Ultimately, success is about enabling our commercial teams to make more money. You will do that by working with:
   

  

* Attribution Models: Full-funnel attribution model live and used consistently by stakeholders.
* Scalable Infrastructure: Systems and workflows that support high-quality, real-time reporting without manual workarounds.
* Insight-Driven Culture: Regularly shipping dashboards and recommendations that influence marketing strategy and budget allocation.
* Cross-Team Alignment: Marketing, Sales, and Analytics are synced on data definitions, campaign tracking, and funnel measurement.
* Innovation: Our revenue teams adopt and leverage modern tools that 10x how we go to market.


**What We're Looking For**
* 5+ years in Revenue Operations, Marketing Operations, Technical Management Consultant or a similar role, preferably at a SaaS or product-led company.
* Strong understanding of B2B buyer journeys, multi-touch attribution model and how to design tracking frameworks to reflect them.
* Familiarity with revenue tools like Salesforce, Braze, Looker, 6sense, Hightouch, or similar.
* Ability to scope and manage cross-functional technical projects involving marketing, data, and engineering.
* Analytical mindset with a focus on business outcomes over vanity metrics.
* Comfortable navigating ambiguity and connecting dots across teams and tools.


***Examples of what we think the ideal profile has experience of***
*Operations at a start-up /scale up
   

  

 Management consulting but with a technical flair either from university education, technical projects or other
   

  

 Technical roles like data / software architect, data engineer, etc. but with business school background or experience in commercial roles or strategy*
**Why This Role Matters**
*You’ll play a pivotal role in ensuring that Mentimeter’s marketing and revenue strategies are powered by
 **clarity, precision, and smart systems** 
 . Your work will help us move from gut feel to data-informed action — accelerating our growth while reducing complexity.*
**Apply today with your CV in English to join our Revenue Operations team at Mentimeter!**
 At Mentimeter where we currently boast over 50+ different nationalities, you'll be part of a culture that values creativity, innovation, and inclusivity. We believe in supporting our team members' growth and offering them the platform to excel. If you're eager to contribute to our mission and make a significant impact, we'd love to hear from you.
   

  

 Not sure you meet 100% of our requirements?
   

  

 Apply anyway and let us know why you would enjoy working on this particular role at Mentimeter!
   

  

 Please note that this role will have its base in our
 **Stockholm** 
**office** 
 and is primarily an
 **onsite** 
 position with the possibility to work from home up to twice per week.
   

  

 Learn more here about Our Ways of Working - Guiding Principles.
   

  

**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page.
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: IT-tekniker på RCO Group
description:
*Öppenhet är en bärande del av vår kultur – vi vet att den skapar en grogrund för utveckling. Genom öppenhet utvecklas både våra medarbetare och vi som bolag, det är bränslet för vår gemensamma resa in i din, vår och samhällets framtid. Att jobba hos RCO innebär att du är med och driver skiftet mot ett öppnare, tryggare och mer hållbart samhälle. Missa inte chansen – ansök redan idag!*
**Din vardag:**
 Som IT-tekniker på RCO Group hanterar du intern IT-support, drift och utveckling av vår IT-miljö, där du stöttar våra cirka 230 användare. Du arbetar i en bred roll inom en liten IT-avdelning med korta beslutsvägar, vilket ger dig stora möjligheter att påverka både tekniska lösningar och arbetssätt.
   

  

 I din roll kommer du att:
   

  

* Hantera och lösa inkommande incidenter och serviceförfrågningar via vårt ärendehanteringssystem
* Kommunicera och vägleda användare på ett pedagogiskt sätt
* Underhålla, felsöka och installera klienter, applikationer, servrar och nätverk
* Driva och följa upp IT-relaterade ärenden i dialog med externa konsulter och leverantörer
* Skapa och uppdatera dokumentation, instruktioner och guider för både IT-avdelningen och användare
* Aktivt identifiera och genomföra förbättringar inom IT-miljön och våra arbetssätt


 Du arbetar från vårt huvudkontor i Frösunda, Solna, och rapporterar direkt till CIO.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som har en gedigen bakgrund inom IT och som trivs i en roll där du får ta ansvar och arbeta självständigt. Du har en god problemlösningsförmåga och ser möjligheter snarare än hinder. Vidare har du lätt att anpassa din kommunikation efter mottagaren och har en naturlig fallenhet för att skapa goda relationer.
   

  

 Vi tror att du:
   

  

* Har minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av drift och underhåll av interna IT-miljöer
* Har erfarenhet av Active Directory, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Intune, Windows Server och VMware
* Har arbetat med kravställning mot externa leverantörer och konsulter
* Kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift


 Meriterande erfarenheter:
   

  

* Tidigare arbete som IT-konsult med insyn i flera olika IT-miljöer
* Erfarenhet av PowerShell, Cisco Meraki och Linux
* Kunskap om IT-säkerhet och standarder som ISO 27001


 RCO Group befinner sig på en spännande resa. Vi erbjuder dig bra förutsättningar för din utveckling – när du utvecklas, utvecklas vi. Självklart erbjuder vi också förmåner som bland annat tjänstepension, kollektivavtal, friskvårdsbidrag och friskvårdstimme. Tjänsten är placerad på vårt huvudkontor i Frösunda, Solna.
   

  

**Hur är det att jobba på RCO Group?**
 På RCO Group har vi en arbetskultur som präglas av öppenhet. För oss är det viktigt med en trygg och schysst stämning där vi litar på varandra för det är så vi skapar en grogrund för utveckling. Vi jobbar utifrån fyra värderingar:
   

  

* Vi omfamnar morgondagen
* Vi bygger tillit
* Vi agerar smart
* Vi växer tillsammans


 Läs mer om oss på https://www.rco.se/om-rco-security/rco-group
   

  

**Hur ansöker jag?**
 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar RCO Group med Wise IT. Vill du veta mer om jobbet, kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult, Sandra Åhs på sandra.ahs@wiseit.se
   

  

 Wise IT kan tyvärr inte ta emot ansökningar via mail, då vi värnar om din personliga integritet. Du kan läsa mer om hur vi behandlar personuppgifter enligt GDPR i Wise Group-koncernens policy för behandling av personuppgifter.
   

  

 Urval sker löpande. I och med verksamhetens karaktär genomför vi som en del av vår rekryteringsprocess bakgrundskontroller. Innan en bakgrundskontroll kommer du ombedjas ge ditt samtycke.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**Öppna för ett större sammanhang**
 Att vara en del av RCO innebär att du är en del av ett större sammanhang. I RCO Group ingår RCO Security, Nimly och Swedlock. Gemensamt för bolagen i gruppen är att vi utvecklar, tillverkar och säljer tjänster och produkter inom lås- och säkerhetssystem. Tillsammans täcker vi upp de flesta av marknadens behov – från det privata hemmet till offentlig sektor och företag i alla branscher. På RCO har vi en kultur som präglas av öppenhet inför idéer, människor, ny teknik och olika perspektiv. Vi är certifierade Great Place to Work® och sedan 2022 anslutna till FN:s initiativ UN Global Compact.
   

  

 Tillsammans är vi i RCO Group cirka 230 medarbetare, vi omsätter drygt 600 miljoner kronor och är aktiva i tre länder (Sverige Norge och Finland). RCO Group ägs av Novax som ingår i familjeföretaget Axel Johnson AB.

title: Marketing Manager - Nordics
description:
**Who we are:**
 For over 20 years, Global Relay has set the standard in enterprise information archiving with industry-leading cloud archiving, surveillance, eDiscovery, and analytics solutions.
